tool_description: Introducing a cutting-edge API solution explicitly tailored for forward-thinking financial institutions that aim to swiftly integrate Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) impact benefits into their digital platforms.
name: ESG Impact API
title: ESG Impact API

api_list.name: writeHtmlFrameworkToBlockchain
api_list.description: Writes the Framework to the blockchain for a particular Reporting Year.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com/writeHtmlFrameworkToBlockchain"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com/writeHtmlFrameworkToBlockchain"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: addPosition
api_list.description: Adds an investment in a specified green Asset for a particular Investor. Can also update an existing Position's invested amount. Reporting Year and Position Days are used when calculating the impact, but are optional (position can be added without impact calculation).

api_list.name: addYearSpecificsToFramework
api_list.description:
Adds Reporting Year specific information to the green Framework. Can also change values for value_outstanding, allocated_amount, and value_outstanding_framework.

value_outstanding_framework is a flag which tells the impact calculation engine how to relate the indicator impact values to the category investment volumes. If set to yes, it means that the indicator impact values relate to the green asset's (e.g. bond's) outstanding value rather than to the amount allocated to green projects, when calculating the potential overlap ratio. The overlap ratio comes in play when the sum of the category investment does equal the total.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com/addYearSpecificsToFramework"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: addIndicator
api_list.description:
Adds an Indicator to your Taxonomy for a particular Reporting Year. In case you only need one level of Indicators, you keep Indicator and Super Indicator identical.

"indicator_name_changed" is used on existing Indicators when you want to change the current Indicator Name, i.e. "indicator_name". (optional)

"super_indicator_id_changed" is used on existing Indicators when you want to change the current Super Indicator ID, i.e. "super_indicator_id". (optional)

"unit_id_changed" is used on existing Indicators when you want to change the current Unit ID, i.e. "unit_id". (optional)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com/addIndicator"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: addSuperIndicator
api_list.description:
Adds a Super Indicator to your Taxonomy for a particular Reporting Year. In case you only need one level of Indicators, you keep Indicator and Super Indicator identical.

"super_indicator_name_changed" is used on existing Super Indicators when you want to change the current Super Indicator Name, i.e. "super_indicator_name". (optional)

"category_id_changed" is used on existing Super Indicators when you want to change the current Category ID, i.e. "category_id". (optional)

api_list.name: addSubCategory
api_list.description:
Adds a Sub Category to your Taxonomy for a particular Reporting Year. In case you only need one level of Categories, you keep Category and Sub Category identical.

"sub_category_name_changed" is used on existing Sub Categories when you want to change the current Sub Category Name, i.e. "sub_category_name". (optional)

"category_id_changed" is used on existing Sub Categories when you want to change the current Category ID, i.e. "category_id". (optional)

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: generateInvestorIdentifier
api_list.description: Generates an Investor Identifier for cases where the actual identifier should not be stored in the ESG Impact API database. Instead this Investor Identifier is stored in the solution which is consuming from the API and matched there with the actual identifier. Generated Investor Identifiers are stored and checked to avoid accidental duplications.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com/generateInvestorIdentifier"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "esg-impact-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
